column5: Yea, a funny thing happens in the country every winter. And each and every year many are surprised. We have a family in town that are hosting refugees from Africa. We got a dusting Tuesday and they were flipping out. Never saw snow first hand in their lives.
Yup---be esp careful of any back and forth rhythmic motions on that LUV seat!!

I went out today. I stopped counting the cars in the ditches. 2 in the same ditch. Less than an inch of snow. It was slick though. I had to put her in 4 wheel. I almost joined them and locked up a few times through a stop and put the front wheels through the shoulder onto the grass turning,,,, too fast.
Hahaha,  speed isn't at fault, lack of friction will put you into the rhubarb every time.
We don't need the snow just cold temps and no wind so we can make some solid ice! Snow just makes people forget how to drive!
Sure is pretty out side.
Yup lots of snow
We Canadians---we know how this goes!!!
Pretty ...awful if you ask me !!! LOL!! j/k but you can keep it up there. Kawartha Kev
Glad to see someone else get the dump for a change!! LOL My view from yesterday has changed minimally this morning, may have got 2" overnight but still snowing lightly.
Someones been busy. How was the harvest this year Wayne ? Any brutes ?
They should just officially change the city's name to Barried. lol

#*+@% snow,  I looked at the shovel and without touching it my back started twitching.  Not enough for the blower, thank god it's fluffy and light.  As much as I'm not a fan of them,  I may have to resort to a small plow for the ATV.  Barrie renamed to Burried,  Angus to Anguish, or just pull the "G" and yu know.
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ So no more grass back ground for you,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, LOL

Don't forget to buy those OFSC trail permits before the price goes up again in a couple weeks....  Fisherman, what's wrong with a blade on an ATV? The worst thing about them is your neighbors will start expecting you to do theirs too...
Just drove past little lake..   half froze over!
Trying to go easy this year and just cleaning up some dead stuff.. LOL..  36" maple and a 28" Ash. Made Leah a love seat, coffee and end table!
A tiny bit rustic but a little sanding here and there and it's ready for the living room! lol
Ariens started up first pull this morning.   Snow was pretty fluffy, got a good 12+ inches here where I am.
Look great in the REC ROOM Wayne. ?

Be a bugger getting it in Kelvin, this is as high as the little Kubota would lift it so I could move it to where the Boss wanted it. .. and that was by cheating and lifting it, then putting the hoe out full to use as a weighted lever to lift the front up a bit. Still snowing here!!!! Where's that sunshine they promised for 1PM ??
That love seat will get you splinters!  Go for a log cabin. Nice to see you back Wayne.
I started my 29-year-old Craftsman two weeks ago. Took a few pulls, there is a spring-loaded ajusting screw under the carb and every time I use it it needs adjusting!!! It runs like new after that.
? What to BOSS wants the BOSS gets RIGHT Wayne..?
Now Where did Leah want it ?
Under a different tree, with a full view down the front yard.
HAPPY WIFE... HAPPY LIFE . Been a while since l got you in trouble Wayne ?
I don't need help Kelvin!
?LOL ?
